result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Klint was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney James D Babbitt.  Defendant in custody.  DOC agent Sandra Frigo in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:45)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentence - deft has done every treatment program available - has substantial jail time credit - agrees with recommendation of dept
14CF47 - 314 days credit
15CF54 - 367 days credit
13CF427 - 168 days credit
15CM441 - was concurrent time
Frigo - has different calculations
14CF47 - 362 days
13CF427 - 168 days
15CF54 - 352 days
15CM441 - 37 days
Rivard agrees except for one matter
14CF47 has 372 days
Rivard argues for time served - the only matter really talking about is 13CF427 other matters time have been served - requests no more then an addtl 30 days on 13CF427, one year on the two felonies and sentence completed on misd. -  allow huber
Deft - addresses the court - believes he's paid about $600 directly to RCU on the restitution

COURT:  14cf47 - 365 days jail - credit 362 days - owe $433.29 made judgment - rest $1152.87 judgment (DOC & deft to check on the actual balance)
15CF54 - 365 days jail - credit 352 days - $318 cc made judg
13CF427 - 320 days - credit 169 days consecutive to the above two - $518 cc made judg
15CM441 - 37 days jail - credit 37 days - $443 cc made judg
HUBER ALLOWED FOR WORK AND TREATMENT
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 22, 2016 at 11:45 am.
DOC requests sentencing after revocation hearing; all files to Br II for scheduling.
Request to modify sentence is denied
returned with no employment - deft in DCJ until June 6, 2015 - judgment already done - deft can make payments as needed until paid in full per DL

Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Donna Burger.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Brad Erickson DOC in court.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:59)  
Burger - addresses the court - original sentence 6 mo cond jail with 4 mo stayed
State - no objection
Deft wants to go to his treatment now
Erickson - wants the 4 months to get him into treatment
Deft - addresses the court
State - will be facing another charge for escape - deny huber

COURT:  10 months jail - lift stay on addtl 4 months to be imposed
no huber allowed
FROM DOC

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:37)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Burger - have agreement 
State - need to do DAGP up
break taken
(11:52)  recalled
State - agreement plea to 14CF47 - w/held sent 2 yrs prob - 6 mo jail if successful in drug court deft will have to do 2 months, $268 cc, $250 surchg., rest. $1450.05 (payments have been made) to RCU - then deft will plea to 13CF427 Ct 1 which is a DAGP
Deft. - 13CF427 - Ct 1 pleads no contest)
           14CF47 - pleads no contest)
deft waives rights & jury trial

COURT:  13CF427 Ct 1 & 14CF47 - pleas made voluntarily & willingly
13CF427 Ct 1 - defers acceptance 24 months - REVIEW HEARING 11-14-2016 at 8:30 a.m.

14CF47 - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 2 years probation 
$268 cc - PAYMENT PLAN
$250 surcharge 
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
restitution $1453.05 to RCU - some payments have already been made that the balance is around $500 - DOC 31 to be filed
6 months jail - 4 months stayed if successful with drug court thru program in Tomah to commence immediately after incarceration and perform and follow thru treatment - deft will only have to do 2 months jail to start by November 21, 2014 at 5 p.m. - HUBER for work & treatment
assessment and comply with any treatment

DISMISS:  14CM64, 14CM65, 14CM66, 13CF427 Ct 2, 3, 4, 13TR8700  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:38)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Deft - wasn't aware he had court - got a call from mother that officer was there to pick him up on warrant - contacted his atty - wasn't responsible
Burger - missed an arraignment - was given an offer they may take - go ahead and do arraignment get pre-trial return dates
14CF47 - arraignment -  Deft waives reading & speedy prelim pleads not guilty

COURT:  Quash warrants -  bonds reinstated
all files together
  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Donna Burger appeared without the defendant.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:32)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State moves for warrant on all files

COURT:  Bench warrant on all files - not forfeiting bond

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:40)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State calls Officer Folcyzk - sworn
Cross by Burger
State argues
Burger argues
State recalls Officer Folcyzk
Witness identifies the deft

COURT:  finds probable cause for bind over 
ALL CASES TO TAG TOGETHER
  Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

(3:19)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Burger - arraignment on 13CF427
              waives reading & speedy trial - pleads not guilty
              haven't had prelim in 14CF47

COURT:  Prelim on 14CF47 - all other files tagalong
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
